data.title: University of Texas Athletics
data.meta_description:
Jaydon Blue (23) RB  - 



A third-year running back who has played in 23 games . . . on 2024 preseason watch lists for the Doak Walker Award and Paul Hornung
data.text:
A third-year running back who has played in 23 games . . . on 2024 preseason watch lists for the Doak Walker Award and Paul Hornung Award.

SOPHOMORE (2023)

Played in all 14 games … rushed 65 times for 398 yards and three touchdowns and caught 14 passes for 135 yards and one touchdown … rushed 10 times for 55 yards in the season-opening victory over Rice … totaled 13 carries for 57 rushing yards with a 7-yard reception in victories over Alabama, Wyoming, Baylor and Kansas … saw game action against Oklahoma in the Red River Rivalry and in the win at Houston … rushed four times for 44 yards, including a 34-yard run, and scored his first career touchdown in the victory over BYU … had two carries for 11 yards against Kansas State and appeared in the win at TCU … rushed seven times for 18 yards at Iowa State and caught a career-high four passes for 31 yards … had a career day against Texas Tech with 10 carries for 121 yards and one touchdown, including a 69-yard run … marked the first 100-yard game of his career … carried the ball 10 times for 33 yards and hauled in three receptions for a career-best 38 yards and his first career receiving touchdown against Oklahoma State in the Big 12 Championship Game … rushed nine times for 59 yards (6.6 ypc) and one touchdown in the CFP semifinal against Washington … also caught four passes for a career-high 45 yards in the Sugar Bowl against the Huskies and returned three kickoffs for 80 yards with a long of 31 yards.

FRESHMAN (2022)

Has played in nine games … rushed 15 times for 33 yards with a long of 10 yards ... made his Longhorn debut against ULM and had three carries for three yards … had five carries for 14 yards in the AT&T Red River Showdown against Oklahoma … carried the ball seven times for 16 yards at Kansas ... played in the Alamo Bowl versus Washington.
